title: Keep pinned tabs
content:
Is there a way to keep pinned tabs on the current website? I would like to pin a few tabs that persist even if I use the URL bar to navigate away from it.

Let's say I have gmail as a pinned tab. Currently if I'm in gmail and I type in a different URL then gmail is no longer available, I'd like firefox to know that I want to keep gmail open and it would open the URL in a different tab. Is this a possibility or is there an extension that could help with this?
creator: marc.e.fleming

title: Firefox displaying connection reset errors, but Opera works fine
content:
Firefox has been working for years on this PC since I bought it.

Today when I try to access say, google.com, or any other URL in Firefox , the browser returns "The connection was reset" and fails to load the page or any other.

I installed Opera and it works fine ....

I can access any other internet resource from the PC, e.g FTP, Remote MySQL, I can ping domains e.g. google.com

In FF I Flushed entire cache - no change.

I have uninstalled FF, removed Mozilla in %Programdata%, %Appdata% and all registry entries then re-installed FF , but still getting "The connection was reset" ...

Switched off Kaspersky - no change

Windows 10 22H2 (19045.2604)
creator: upsalla
